channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta Plans to Cut 600 Jobs at A.I. Superintelligence Labs
item.description: The cuts will not affect Meta’s newest A.I. hires, who are in some cases being paid up to hundreds of millions of dollars. The layoffs are focused on ...

item.title: The Louvre Has Reopened, but the Thieves Are Still at Large
item.description: Visitors are returning, but the French authorities are under growing scrutiny about security arrangements after four thieves stole royal jewelry worth...

item.title: Deadly floods in Mexico that killed 76 people trigger a 5-mile oil spill that could ripple through the gulf economy
item.description: The Pantepec River, where the spill occured, supplies water for a number of communities.

item.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s pay hits a record $96.5 million—he got a 22% pay rise mirroring the $4 trillion tech giant’s skyrocketing shares
item.description: Satya Nadella’s pay hits its highest since becoming Microsoft CEO, driven by a 23% stock surge in 2025 and shares doubling in three years.

item.title: Ivory Coast Gen Zers run low on patience as 83-year-old president runs for fourth term
item.description: More than three-quarters of the West African country's population is under 35.

item.title: Walmart is determined to win the Thanksgiving meal value wars with a $40 dinner for 10 people
item.description: The Butterball turkey is at its lowest price since 2019, Walmart U.S. president and CEO John Furner said.

item.title: In First Six Months, Cost of Weather Catastrophes Escalated at a Record Pace
item.description: The Trump administration stopped updating a database tracking the costs of the country’s worst disasters. A group of scientists has revived it.

item.title: Zelensky Says Strike on Kindergarten Shows Putin Isn’t Serious About Talks
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said an assault by Russia, hours after President Trump put off a meeting with President Vladimir Putin, showed...

item.title: No Kings Means No Kings. No Wonder Trump Hates It.
Apple is ‘drastically’ cutting iPhone Air production, report says, after new survey reveals ‘virtually no demand’
item.description: Production of the iPhone Air, starting next month, will be "less than 10% of the volume compared with September."

item.title: On the Menu in New York: One Repair, Coming Right Up
item.description: The state leads the country in “repair cafes,” which bring neighbors together while keeping all manner of items out of the trash.
